item.title: Cannot Find Symbol[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:2, topic:477825”]why would you declare resetArrow(); in the PacketSender class?

well Client extends Player, so declare resetArrow(); in Player.java.

if you would like to use it from the PacketSender class (which i suggest you don’t), then do: PacketSender.resetArrow();

then you’ll have to make the resetArrow declaration static (as it’s referenced from the PacketSender class).

or c.getPacketSender().resetArrow(); that if you don’t want to make it static.

didn’t see you solved it, SORRY[/quote]
It’s okay, you were on the same bunny trail as I was.

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot Find Symbol[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

why would you declare resetArrow(); in the PacketSender class?

well Client extends Player, so declare resetArrow(); in Player.java.

if you would like to use it from the PacketSender class (which i suggest you don’t), then do: PacketSender.resetArrow();

then you’ll have to make the resetArrow declaration static (as it’s referenced from the PacketSender class).

or c.getPacketSender().resetArrow(); that if you don’t want to make it static.

didn’t see you solved it, SORRY

Read full topic

item.title: Cannot Find Symbol[SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’m using a 317 PI.
Here’s my error:
(Too lazy to copy the cmd)
Cannot find symbol c.resetArrow();
But it says it can’t find variable c of type Client.

If I change it to resetArrow(); it cannot find resetArrow();

resetArrow(); is in the PacketSender class, which is located here: com.rs2.net;

so I imported it here (FirstClickNPC class):
import com.rs2.net.PacketSender;
Yes. PacketSender has the P and S capitalized.
I double checked the imports, spelling, and such.
Anyone got a clue why I get either of the errors?

Alright, here’s what I did:
I changed: c.resetArrow();
to: c.getPacketSender().resetArrow();

Read full topic
